db:abstract.db:para: The QFileSystemModel class provides a data model for the local filesystem.
This class was introduced in Qt 4.4.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: This class provides access to the local filesystem, providing functions for renaming and removing files and directories, and for creating new directories. In the simplest case, it can be used with a suitable display widget as part of a browser or filter.

QFileSystemModel can be accessed using the standard interface provided by QAbstractItemModel, but it also provides some convenience functions that are specific to a directory model. The fileInfo(), isDir(), fileName() and filePath() functions provide information about the underlying files and directories related to items in the model. Directories can be created and removed using mkdir(), rmdir().

db:note.db:para: QFileSystemModel requires an instance of QApplication.

db:section.db:title: Example Usage
db:section.db:para: A directory model that displays the contents of a default directory is usually constructed with a parent object:
A tree view can be used to display the contents of the model
and the contents of a particular directory can be displayed by setting the tree view's root index:

The view's root index can be used to control how much of a hierarchical model is displayed. QFileSystemModel provides a convenience function that returns a suitable model index for a path to a directory within the model.

db:section.db:title: Caching and Performance
db:section.db:para: QFileSystemModel will not fetch any files or directories until setRootPath() is called. This will prevent any unnecessary querying on the file system until that point such as listing the drives on Windows.

Unlike QDirModel, QFileSystemModel uses a separate thread to populate itself so it will not cause the main thread to hang as the file system is being queried. Calls to rowCount() will return 0 until the model populates a directory.
QFileSystemModel keeps a cache with file information. The cache is automatically kept up to date using the QFileSystemWatcher.

db:section.db:title: nameFilterDisables : bool
db:section.db:para: This property holds whether files that don't pass the name filter are hidden or disabled
This property is true by default

db:section.db:title: readOnly : bool
db:section.db:para: This property holds whether the directory model allows writing to the file system
If this property is set to false, the directory model will allow renaming, copying and deleting of files and directories.
This property is true by default

db:section.db:title: resolveSymlinks : bool
db:section.db:para: This property holds whether the directory model should resolve symbolic links
This is only relevant on Windows.
By default, this property is true.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QFileSystemModel::QFileSystemModel(QObject *parent = Q_NULLPTR)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a file system model with the given parent.

db:section.db:title: [virtual noexcept] QFileSystemModel::~QFileSystemModel()
db:section.db:para: Destroys this file system model.

db:section.db:title: [override virtual] bool QFileSystemModel::canFetchMore(const QModelIndex &parent) const
db:section.db:para: Reimplements: QAbstractItemModel::canFetchMore(const QModelIndex &parent) const.

db:section.db:title: [override virtual] int QFileSystemModel::columnCount(const QModelIndex &parent = QModelIndex()) const
db:section.db:para: Reimplements: QAbstractItemModel::columnCount(const QModelIndex &parent) const.

db:section.db:title: [override virtual] QVariant QFileSystemModel::data(const QModelIndex &index, int role = Qt::DisplayRole) const
db:section.db:para: Reimplements: QAbstractItemModel::data(const QModelIndex &index, int role) const.

db:section.db:title: [since 4.7] void QFileSystemModel::directoryLoaded(const QString &path)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when the gatherer thread has finished to load the path.
This function was introduced in Qt 4.7.

db:section.db:title: [override virtual] bool QFileSystemModel::dropMimeData(const QMimeData *data, Qt::DropAction action, int row, int column, const QModelIndex &parent)
db:section.db:para: Reimplements: QAbstractItemModel::dropMimeData(const QMimeData *data, Qt::DropAction action, int row, int column, const QModelIndex &parent).
Handles the data supplied by a drag and drop operation that ended with the given action over the row in the model specified by the row and column and by the parent index.

db:section.db:title: [override virtual protected] bool QFileSystemModel::event(QEvent *event)
db:section.db:para: Reimplements: QObject::event(QEvent *e).

db:section.db:title: [override virtual] void QFileSystemModel::fetchMore(const QModelIndex &parent)
db:section.db:para: Reimplements: QAbstractItemModel::fetchMore(const QModelIndex &parent).

db:section.db:title: QIcon QFileSystemModel::fileIcon(const QModelIndex &index) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the icon for the item stored in the model under the given index.

db:section.db:title: QFileInfo QFileSystemModel::fileInfo(const QModelIndex &index) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the QFileInfo for the item stored in the model under the given index.

db:section.db:title: QString QFileSystemModel::fileName(const QModelIndex &index) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the file name for the item stored in the model under the given index.

db:section.db:title: QString QFileSystemModel::filePath(const QModelIndex &index) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the path of the item stored in the model under the index given.

db:section.db:title: void QFileSystemModel::fileRenamed(const QString &path, const QString &oldName, const QString &newName)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted whenever a file with the oldName is successfully renamed to newName. The file is located in in the directory path.

db:section.db:title: QDir::Filters QFileSystemModel::filter() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the filter specified for the directory model.
If a filter has not been set, the default filter is QDir::AllEntries | QDir::NoDotAndDotDot | QDir::AllDirs.

db:section.db:title: [override virtual] Qt::ItemFlags QFileSystemModel::flags(const QModelIndex &index) const
db:section.db:para: Reimplements: QAbstractItemModel::flags(const QModelIndex &index) const.

db:section.db:title: [override virtual] bool QFileSystemModel::hasChildren(const QModelIndex &parent = QModelIndex()) const
db:section.db:para: Reimplements: QAbstractItemModel::hasChildren(const QModelIndex &parent) const.

db:section.db:title: [override virtual] QVariant QFileSystemModel::headerData(int section, Qt::Orientation orientation, int role = Qt::DisplayRole) const
db:section.db:para: Reimplements: QAbstractItemModel::headerData(int section, Qt::Orientation orientation, int role) const.

db:section.db:title: QFileIconProvider *QFileSystemModel::iconProvider() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the file icon provider for this directory model.

db:section.db:title: [override virtual] QModelIndex QFileSystemModel::index(int row, int column, const QModelIndex &parent = QModelIndex()) const
db:section.db:para: Reimplements: QAbstractItemModel::index(int row, int column, const QModelIndex &parent) const.

db:section.db:title: QModelIndex QFileSystemModel::index(const QString &path, int column = 0) const
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns the model item index for the given path and column.

db:section.db:title: bool QFileSystemModel::isDir(const QModelIndex &index) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the model item index represents a directory; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: QDateTime QFileSystemModel::lastModified(const QModelIndex &index) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the date and time when index was last modified.

db:section.db:title: [override virtual] QMimeData *QFileSystemModel::mimeData(const QModelIndexList &indexes) const
db:section.db:para: Reimplements: QAbstractItemModel::mimeData(const QModelIndexList &indexes) const.
Returns an object that contains a serialized description of the specified indexes. The format used to describe the items corresponding to the indexes is obtained from the mimeTypes() function.
If the list of indexes is empty, 0 is returned rather than a serialized empty list.

db:section.db:title: [override virtual] QStringList QFileSystemModel::mimeTypes() const
db:section.db:para: Reimplements: QAbstractItemModel::mimeTypes() const.
Returns a list of MIME types that can be used to describe a list of items in the model.

db:section.db:title: QModelIndex QFileSystemModel::mkdir(const QModelIndex &parent, const QString &name)
db:section.db:para: Create a directory with the name in the parent model index.

db:section.db:title: QVariant QFileSystemModel::myComputer(int role = Qt::DisplayRole) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the data stored under the given role for the item "My Computer".

db:section.db:title: QStringList QFileSystemModel::nameFilters() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a list of filters applied to the names in the model.

db:section.db:title: [override virtual] QModelIndex QFileSystemModel::parent(const QModelIndex &index) const
db:section.db:para: Reimplements: QAbstractItemModel::parent(const QModelIndex &index) const.

db:section.db:title: QFileDevice::Permissions QFileSystemModel::permissions(const QModelIndex &index) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the complete OR-ed together combination of QFile::Permission for the index.

db:section.db:title: bool QFileSystemModel::remove(const QModelIndex &index)
db:section.db:para: Removes the model item index from the file system model and deletes the corresponding file from the file system, returning true if successful. If the item cannot be removed, false is returned.

db:warning.db:para: This function deletes files from the file system; it does not move them to a location where they can be recovered.

db:section.db:title: bool QFileSystemModel::rmdir(const QModelIndex &index)
db:section.db:para: Removes the directory corresponding to the model item index in the file system model and deletes the corresponding directory from the file system, returning true if successful. If the directory cannot be removed, false is returned.

db:warning.db:para: This function deletes directories from the file system; it does not move them to a location where they can be recovered.

db:section.db:title: QDir QFileSystemModel::rootDirectory() const
db:section.db:para: The currently set directory

db:section.db:title: QString QFileSystemModel::rootPath() const
db:section.db:para: The currently set root path

db:section.db:title: void QFileSystemModel::rootPathChanged(const QString &newPath)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted whenever the root path has been changed to a newPath.

db:section.db:title: [override virtual] int QFileSystemModel::rowCount(const QModelIndex &parent = QModelIndex()) const
db:section.db:para: Reimplements: QAbstractItemModel::rowCount(const QModelIndex &parent) const.

db:section.db:title: [override virtual] bool QFileSystemModel::setData(const QModelIndex &idx, const QVariant &value, int role = Qt::EditRole)
db:section.db:para: Reimplements: QAbstractItemModel::setData(const QModelIndex &index, const QVariant &value, int role).

db:section.db:title: void QFileSystemModel::setFilter(QDir::Filters filters)
db:section.db:para: Sets the directory model's filter to that specified by filters.
Note that the filter you set should always include the QDir::AllDirs enum value, otherwise QFileSystemModel won't be able to read the directory structure.

db:section.db:title: void QFileSystemModel::setIconProvider(QFileIconProvider *provider)
db:section.db:para: Sets the provider of file icons for the directory model.

db:section.db:title: void QFileSystemModel::setNameFilters(const QStringList &filters)
db:section.db:para: Sets the name filters to apply against the existing files.

db:section.db:title: QModelIndex QFileSystemModel::setRootPath(const QString &newPath)
db:section.db:para: Sets the directory that is being watched by the model to newPath by installing a file system watcher on it. Any changes to files and directories within this directory will be reflected in the model.
If the path is changed, the rootPathChanged() signal will be emitted.

db:note.db:para: This function does not change the structure of the model or modify the data available to views. In other words, the "root" of the model is not changed to include only files and directories within the directory specified by newPath in the file system.

db:section.db:title: qint64 QFileSystemModel::size(const QModelIndex &index) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the size in bytes of index. If the file does not exist, 0 is returned.

db:section.db:title: [override virtual] void QFileSystemModel::sort(int column, Qt::SortOrder order = Qt::AscendingOrder)
db:section.db:para: Reimplements: QAbstractItemModel::sort(int column, Qt::SortOrder order).

db:section.db:title: [override virtual] Qt::DropActions QFileSystemModel::supportedDropActions() const
db:section.db:para: Reimplements: QAbstractItemModel::supportedDropActions() const.

db:section.db:title: [override virtual protected] void QFileSystemModel::timerEvent(QTimerEvent *event)
db:section.db:para: Reimplements: QObject::timerEvent(QTimerEvent *event).

db:section.db:title: QString QFileSystemModel::type(const QModelIndex &index) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the type of file index such as "Directory" or "JPEG file".
